title: Beige Hoodie — Color discrepancy

listingInfo.title: Oversized Beige Hoodie
listingInfo.disclosedFlaws: None; seller stated photos were taken by phone.
listingInfo.attributes: Cotton fleece, mid-thickness, worn 3–4 times, machine washable, purchased from Uniqlo.

complaint: Buyer reports the actual hoodie color is significantly darker than shown in seller's bright-window photos. Seller unintentionally created misleading images due to strong natural lighting. Classified as SNAD (SND-501 Misleading Image).

chatLog.text: Hi! Is the hoodie still available?
Yes, still available.
Is the material cotton fleece? Does it feel thick?
Medium thickness, cotton fleece, quite comfortable.
How many times have you worn it? Any pilling?
Around 3–4 times, no pilling so far.
Where did you buy it?
Uniqlo Taiwan.
Anything special I need to be careful with when washing? Does it fade?
I just throw it in the washing machine, no fading.
Okay, I'll buy it. Please ship to 7-11 Minquan East.
Okay, I'll ship it this afternoon.
Order created – Order ID: TW-15011
Shipped.
Package has arrived at the store.
Picked it up~
I received the hoodie, but the color is really different from the photos. In the photos it looked like light beige, but the actual item is closer to dark yellow/brown. (Attached natural-light photos)
Huh? Why is it so different? Maybe I was near the window when taking photos and the lighting was too strong. I really didn’t edit anything—my phone probably auto-brightened the picture.
Yeah, I know it wasn’t intentional. But I bought it expecting light beige, and the actual color really isn’t the same.
Looking at your photos, it is indeed a lot darker. Sorry, I honestly didn’t realize lighting would change it that much.
So I would like to request a return.
Okay… I’ll let the system decide.
Buyer submitted a return request.
Seller rejected return → AI review required.
